Rehabilitation Consultant

Company Name Nabenet Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 47 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Nabenet are seeking a self-motivated and driven Rehabilitation Consultant to join its award winning team. Nabenet is a leading Occupational Rehabilitation Provider in Victoria. We're an independent Australian owned company and an approved provider for WorkSafe Victoria and Comcare. Nabenet specialise in the management of workplace injuries with a focus on early intervention. This role will be based in Melbourne at the head office in Hawthorn, working with a fantastic team.\xa0


The role


  • Your role will be to assist injured claimants return to work on a safe and sustainable basis.

  • Utilise your problem solving skills, clinical experience and knowledge of injury management to perform assessments and facilitate the return to work of claimants.

  • Perform worksite assessments and use lateral thinking and forward planning skills to identify potential return to work pathways in line with likely recovery milestones.

  • Use your communication skills to liaise with a variety of stakeholders, including insurance companies, medical practitioners, employers and employees.

  • Work in a fast paced environment, driven by the company values of quality, customer service, outcomes and team work.


To be successful

  • You must have a tertiary qualification, and current registration with the appropriate body, in either Physiotherapy, Occupational Therapy, Nursing, Exercise Physiology, Psychology or Rehabilitation Counselling.

  • Have at least 1-2 years work experience post completion of your degree.

  • Have excellent time management skills.

  • Be a confident communicator and are comfortable liaising with a variety of stakeholders.

  • Have excellent writing skills and have experience writing reports.

  • Have experience in completing assessments and making recommendations.

  • Have knowledge and understanding of workers' compensation and injury management.


About working at Nabenet


  • Generous professional development budget

  • Thorough induction and ongoing training

  • Laptop and mobile phone provided

  • Social, health and wellbeing events throughout the year

  • Career development opportunities.

Job description

This is a retailer that is thriving and growing rapidly. Key to their success is a great product offering, large loyal customer base and employees who love what they do. They are looking for an experienced and accomplished merchandise planner to join their furnishings team.

About the Company

This is a homegrown success story that anyone would be proud to be part of. Their success has come from consistently offering outstanding value to their customers. Coming to work each day is a pleasure with offices easily accessible via public transport and plenty of trendy cafe's and shopping nearby. You will love the modern offices that are bustling with energy. Every day is different and there is never a dull moment. What is really great about this role are the career progression opportunities.


Here's why you will love this!
You will be part of a high performing and self-managing merchandise team. In this role, you will work together to deliver the departmental KPI's. The hiring manager is a strong leader and real people person. You will enjoy being deep into the detail with ownership and control whilst supporting and contributing to drive business success. You will be part of a high performing team who are great at what they do where each day is both challenging and fun.. And who doesn’t love working for a business that is succeeding!

Key Roles and Responsibilities

  • OTB management, budgeting and forecasting
  • Inventory Management
  • Analysis and Reporting
  • Financial Management and Trading the business to achieve targets
  • Leading and developing others.

\xa0

Who should apply

We are looking for someone with 5 years Planning experience preferably with a large organisation. You will need extensive analytical and reporting experience with an ability to interpret results and make recommendations. You will need to be confident in meetings with excellent communication skills. Strong excel skills are essential.


If you are ready to progress your career - dont wait!\xa0

This opportunity will be gone quickly!

Only successfull applicants will be contacted.

Marketing Coordinator Events Specialist

Company Name The Hour Glass Limited Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 876 views

Job description

The Role

As the Marketing team member, you will be responsible for the continuous brand representation, effective marketing campaigns and sell through of products at all official retail outlets (Retailers) in Australia.

This opportunity offers great challenges to a motivated candidate looking to work in a friendly, fast paced and growing environment.


Main Responsibilities:

  • Successfully implementing approved marketing plan and visual merchandise.

  • Plan and execute all marketing and sales activities such as exhibitions, dinners, sales-oriented promotions and customer retention programmes.

  • Ensure any advertising and visual merchandise is within the approved brand specifications and code.

  • Continually maintain contact and build rapport with magazine editors, PR companies for brand representation and advertising leverage.

  • Maintain and update the company’s data base for media contacts.

  • Thorough marketing/promotional campaigns to ensure all product categories are represented.

  • Be continually aware of general market trends and competitors promotions that may affect the brand in the Australian Market.

  • Liaising with brands (independent and/or exclusive to THG) for stock ordering, backorder, repairs and marketing.

  • Review of all outlets performance with teams, recommend improvements and use positive reinforcement policies to encourage continued improvement

  • Monitor and identify stock- supply, aging stocks, fast moving items, slow moving items and recommends appropriate actions, and review forward purchases.

  • Provide operational support to all The Hour Glass sales team in respect of procedures, stocks, credit limit, debtor control and manpower

  • Perform other duties as assigned from time to time


    Skills and Requirements

  • The successful applicant will have experience including but not exclusive to:

  • Minimum experience of 1-3 years in wholesale of luxury brands or similar environment including a demonstrated ability to identify and develop alternative solutions to problems, to evaluate courses of action and to reach logical conclusions.

  • Proven experience at successfully managing the sales and marketing function, people, account management, budgets and expenses.

  • A tertiary qualification an advantage.

  • Proven ability at working in a hands-on environment where multitasking ability is paramount.

  • Planned, organised and effectively distinguishes between low and high priority

  • Strong interpersonal skills to effectively lead and motivate others.

  • Ability to take action to achieve goals and go beyond expectation.

  • Well-developed numerical, written and communication skills and the ability to actively and accurately listen to all parties.

  • Ability to respond to questions with confidence, demonstrating knowledge and experience.


Due to the competitive nature of the position, interested candidates should apply online below or email to auhr@thehourglass.com .
\xa0
Please note, due to the high volume of applications received by interested candidates, we will only contact candidates that deemed to be relevant and match the selection criteria.\xa0

853591158:
[

Senior Lawyer

Company Name Australian Government Department of Education and Training Company Location Melbourne CBD, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 336 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Senior Lawyer (VPSG5)


  • Reference: VG/DET/PESG/1354147
  • Occupation: Legal
  • Salary Range: $95,275.00 - $115,276.00
  • Work location: Melbourne | CBD


This is an exciting opportunity to progress your legal career, and to obtain valuable experience in working as a Senior lawyer in the government sector. There is a Senior Lawyer role available within the Legal Division of the Department of Education and Training. The role is within the Workplace and Education Law Branch, which includes the Children, Families and Education Law unit (CFEL), the Negligence litigation unit, and the Workplace, Discrimination and Disputes unit (WDD). This role will be within in the CFEL unit.


This role will involve the provision of specialist, technical and strategic legal advice in a wide range of matters including duty of care, risk management, family law, intervention orders, mandatory reporting, trespass, privacy and subpoenas and can also result in managing proceedings, inquiries or investigations such as those conducted by the Commission for Children and Young People, and the Coroners Court of Victoria.


The primary responsibility of this role is to work closely with Principal Lawyers and Managers and other Senior Lawyers in the Legal Division, to assist in the provision of legal advice in relation to the legislation, policies and operations of the Department and to support the Legal Division's work, including: legal advice, legal research, drafting legal documents, correspondence and briefings; reviewing Department policies and guidelines; preparing reports and liaising with clients and stakeholders.


Senior Lawyers within the Division are leaders, and are accountable for their own work program but also contribute to the broader strategic plans to achieve Divisional priorities, and devise and implement improved systems and processes.


To support the success of the Legal Division, Senior Lawyers will identify and respond to emerging issues. The successful candidate will also have the drive to contribute to innovative policy projects and reforms to improve Department practice in key areas of legal risk.\xa0


This role will require the capacity to prioritise matters and provide urgent advice where necessary. Core capabilities include excellent communication, legal skills and stakeholder management skills.


The position will require a practising certificate.


Department of Education and Training is committed to diversity. The Department places considerable effort and resources into responding to the needs of staff with a disability. People from disadvantaged groups are encouraged to apply for this position. Information about the Department of Education and Training's operations and employment conditions can be obtained from the following websites:www.education.vic.gov.au and http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/Pages/default.aspx.


Applications close 13/09/2018

Performance Marketing and Acquisition specialist - eCommerce

Company Name WeAreDigital Company Location South Yarra, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 224 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


WeAreDigital is a strategic digital commerce and experience consultancy, with a focus on making commerce better and easier - everyday. We are obsessed with achieving results and creating impact for our clients. And our key measures of success are client and employee satisfaction.


We work as partners with local and global brands & retailers, spanning eCommerce, enterprise, consumer goods, fashion, cosmetics, health, finance and sport to deliver products, services, platforms and solutions that people love to use across multi channels.


We are currently hunting for a Performance Marketing and Acquisition specialist on a full-time basis.


Your Mission.

As a Performance Marketing and Acquisition specialist, you will support our Strategic Planning Team in planning, executing and managing results-driven campaigns for a range of exciting clients spanning Retail, Ecommerce, Health and Enterprise.


Your Priorities.

  • Planning, activation, management and optimisation of digital campaigns through platforms such as Facebook Business Manager, Google AdWords, Google Display Network.
  • Analyse campaign results and provide recommendations for ongoing optimisation that deliver against KPIs.
  • Set-up, management and optimisation of ongoing SEO programs using best practice tools such as Moz, SEMrush, Google Search Console.
  • Generate regular cross-channel reports with insights using Google Analytics and support your strategy lead in conducting regular trading meetings with client stakeholders.
  • Assisting with Conversion Rate Optimisation and making informed recommendations to client roadmaps

Desired Skills and Experience:

Your Requirements.

  • Australian permanent resident.
  • 3+ years digital advertising experience in PPC, paid social and SEO planning and campaign management.
  • Experience working within an agency environment.
  • Experience managing client stakeholders.
  • Experience project managing ongoing programs of work or retainers.
  • Experience making informed recommendations to clients.
  • An understanding of integrated or multi-channel digital marketing campaigns, customer journeys and lifecycle marketing.
  • An understanding of the digital media landscape: technologies, media buying and management platforms.
  • Qualifications in AdWords required.
  • Qualifications in Google Analytics preferred.
  • Strong proficiency in Excel preferred
  • Qualifications in Business, Marketing or Communications preferred.


Does this sound like you? If so we would love to hear from you.

Front End Developer

Company Name MECCA Brands Company Location 34 Wangaratta St, Richmond, VIC 3121, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 386 views

Job description

We did it! We ranked #2 in the 2017 Best Places to Work study for Australia!

THE ROLE YOU COULD PLAY

\xa0We have an exciting opportunity available for a creative, dynamic, and eager to learn Front End Developer to join our ever growing MECCA Tech team. This role will work closely with our dedicated Digital team and will be responsible for conceiving, planning, developing, and deploying cutting-edge eCommerce web experiences. You will have multiple years of experience writing custom HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and solid understanding of the concept of progressive enhancement, mobile first and future friendly design.

The main responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

  • Write standards-compliant code including testing/debugging in multiple browsers and platforms
  • Works with Visual and UX Designers to translate visual concepts into functional online experiences, microsites, HTML emails, and other digital media
  • Ability to take graphic files and translate them into a functional experience on web and mobile platforms
  • Participate in the functional requirements definitions for new or modified applications
  • Work closely with internal development and design teams to ensure flawless integration with back-end technology and a great user experience
  • Maintain continuous contact with all internal and external stakeholders through the project and after completion making sure features are delivered with high quality and on time
  • May provide assistance, identification and technical analysis for incident troubleshooting
  • Promote good coding practices within their team

WE THINK YOU WOULD BE PERFECT IF…

  • Have extensive experience with E-Commerce websites
  • Have worked with creative teams, UI & UX to ensure there are no technical barriers to suggested designs
  • Superior and efficient HTML5, CSS3 skills; W3C standards and SEO principles
  • Solid understanding of Responsive Design
  • Have a good understanding in the use of JavaScript Libraries and Frameworks, such as React and Angular
  • Proficiency in writing maintainable JavaScript code
  • Understanding of mobile and web-based design constraints, editors, browser platforms, and their differences - along with the experience to develop and code accordingly
  • Some experience with Adobe Creative Cloud Suite (Photoshop, …)
  • A flexible and collaborative approach in fast-paced production environments
  • Ability to provide thoughts and insights throughout the development process, and the ability to constructively contribute technical feedback to the team on various projects

Attributes:

  • Ability to understand business functions to analyse and propose technical strategies for the business
  • Takes personal responsibility for personal growth, acquires strategies for gaining new knowledge, behaviours and skills
  • Ability to breakdown raw information and undefined problems into specific, workable components that in-turn clearly identifies the issues at han
  • Anticipates, identifies and defines problems, seeks root causes and develops practical and timely solutions

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU IF YOU JOIN US
\xa0
We are in the business of delivering happiness to our team members, our customers and our broader community, and we love to acknowledge each team member’s contribution to our success. From quarterly product allowances, unlimited 40% discount and free products, through to reward and recognition programs, professional development programs, and health and well-being initiatives, we promise you that our unique company culture will constantly surprise and delight you - we will never be finished in making MECCA Brands the best place to work!

A LITTLE MORE ABOUT US

At MECCA Brands, we bring customers the best in global beauty across our 4 retail concepts: MECCA Cosmetica, MECCA Maxima, MECCA and mecca.com.au. We offer an exclusive edit of over 100 brands, paired with exceptional customer service and beauty expertise within each retail environment.

Working at MECCA Brands will never be just a job. Our unique and positive culture ensures team members are surrounded by other incredible and inspiring people, amazing opportunities, experiences and challenges, enabling them to be the best they can be in everything they choose to do.

To learn more about life at MECCA Brands and to apply for this position, please visit www.mecca.com.au/careers
